One-Pot Mac and Cheese

Jump to Recipe

Are you ready to indulge in a creamy and cheesy delight that will satisfy your comfort food cravings? Look no further than this easy One-Pot Mac and Cheese recipe! Perfect for busy weeknights or a cozy weekend treat, this dish combines simple ingredients like elbow macaroni, cheddar cheese, and everyday pantry staples to create a delicious meal in just one pot. Not only does it save on dishes, but it also ensures that every bite is packed with flavor and gooey goodness. Whether you're cooking for family or hosting friends, this crowd-pleaser is sure to impress. Plus, with minimal prep time and straightforward cooking steps, you’ll have a warm, cheesy dish ready in no time. Dive into this one-pot wonder and discover how effortless and enjoyable homemade mac and cheese can be!

Ingredients

elbow macaroni

Elbow macaroni is the traditional choice for mac and cheese due to its shape, which holds cheese sauce well. If you need a substitution, you can use any small pasta shape like shells, fusilli, or penne. For a healthier option, consider whole wheat or gluten-free pasta. When cooking, be sure not to overcook the pasta, as it will continue to soften while mixed with the cheese.

cheddar cheese

Sharp cheddar is often preferred for its strong flavor, but you can mix in other cheeses for depth, such as Gruyère, Monterey Jack, or even a bit of cream cheese for creaminess. Pre-shredded cheese contains anti-caking agents that can affect melting, so if possible, shred your cheese fresh from the block. For a dairy-free version, try using cashew cheese or nutritional yeast.

milk

Whole milk will give the creamiest results, but you can use 2% or skim milk if you're looking for a lighter option. For a richer flavor, consider using half-and-half or a combination of milk and cream. If you're lactose intolerant, almond milk or oat milk can be good substitutes, although they may alter the flavor slightly.

butter

Butter adds richness to the dish, but you can substitute it with olive oil or margarine if you're looking for a dairy-free option. For added flavor, try using clarified butter or ghee. Make sure to melt the butter over medium heat to avoid burning it.

salt

Salt enhances flavor, but you can adjust the amount based on your dietary needs. If using salted butter, you might want to reduce the added salt. For a flavor boost, consider using garlic salt or onion salt instead.

black pepper

Black pepper adds a nice kick to the dish. For a different flavor profile, try using white pepper for a milder taste or even cayenne pepper for heat. If you're serving kids or those who prefer milder flavors, you can omit it or reduce the amount.

garlic powder

Garlic powder offers a convenient way to add garlic flavor. If you prefer fresh garlic, you can substitute 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder with one clove of minced garlic. You can also experiment with garlic salt if you want to combine the flavors, but adjust the added salt accordingly.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Melt Butter

    In a large pot, melt 2 tablespoons of butter over medium heat. This will create a rich base for your mac and cheese.

  • Step 2: Combine Ingredients

    Add 2 cups of elbow macaroni, 2 cups of milk, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper, and 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder to the pot. Stir well to combine all ingredients.

  • Step 3: Bring to a Boil

    Increase the heat to bring the mixture to a boil. Keep an eye on it to prevent boiling over.

  • Step 4: Reduce Heat and Cover

    Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Cook for about 10-12 minutes, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the pasta is tender.

  • Step 5: Add Cheese

    Remove the pot from heat and stir in 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese. Mix until the cheese is completely melted and the sauce is creamy.

  • Step 6: Serve and Enjoy

    Serve your one-pot mac and cheese warm. You can sprinkle extra cheese or herbs on top for added flavor.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is the best way to prepare elbow macaroni before cooking?

You don't need to prepare elbow macaroni before cooking; just measure it out and add it directly to the pot with the other ingredients. Make sure to stir occasionally to prevent sticking.

How can I ensure my mac and cheese turns out creamy?

To achieve a creamy texture, make sure to stir in the cheese off the heat. The residual heat will melt the cheese without making it gritty. Using freshly shredded cheese also helps!

What can I substitute for cheddar cheese?

You can substitute cheddar with other cheeses like Monterey Jack, Gouda, or a blend of cheeses. Just keep in mind that different cheeses will alter the flavor slightly.

How do I know if my pasta is done cooking?

Pasta is typically done when it's al dente, meaning it should be tender but still have a slight bite to it. Check it a minute or two before the recommended cooking time.

Is it safe to leave the pot unattended while cooking?

It's best to stay near the pot while cooking, especially when bringing it to a boil. If you need to step away, make sure to lower the heat to prevent it from boiling over.

Can I add vegetables or protein to my mac and cheese?

Absolutely! You can add cooked vegetables like broccoli or peas, or protein such as cooked chicken or bacon. Just add them during the last few minutes of cooking.

How do I clean up after making this dish?

Soak any burnt-on cheese or pasta in warm soapy water for a few minutes to loosen it. Use a non-abrasive sponge to scrub the pot. For easy cleanup, consider lining your pot with parchment paper before cooking.

What kitchen tools do I need to make one-pot mac and cheese?

You'll need a large pot, a measuring cup for the ingredients, a wooden spoon or spatula for stirring, and a cheese grater if you're shredding your cheese.

How do I prevent my milk from scorching?

To prevent scorching, always cook over medium heat and stir the mixture frequently. If it starts to bubble up, reduce the heat immediately.

Can I make this recipe in advance?

Yes! You can prepare the mac and cheese in advance and store it in the refrigerator. Just reheat it gently on the stove, adding a splash of milk to restore creaminess.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For a gluten-free version, substitute the elbow macaroni with gluten-free pasta. To make it vegetarian, ensure the cheese used is rennet-free. If you're looking for a lower-fat option, use reduced-fat cheese and milk. For a vegan alternative, you can try using cashew cheese or a store-bought vegan cheese and plant-based milk, making sure to adjust the cooking time as needed.

Pairings

Pair your One-Pot Mac and Cheese with a light, refreshing salad such as a mixed greens salad with a lemon vinaigrette to balance the richness of the cheese. For a heartier option, consider adding grilled chicken or crispy bacon on the side. When it comes to beverages, a crisp lager or a fruity iced tea complements the dish well, while a smooth Chardonnay can also enhance the flavors of the cheese.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the mac and cheese in deep bowls for a cozy feel, and consider topping each serving with additional shredded cheese or crispy breadcrumbs for added texture. A sprinkle of fresh herbs, such as parsley or chives, can add a pop of color and freshness. For a fun twist, you could serve it alongside a small dish of hot sauce for those who enjoy a spicy kick.

#

One-Pot Mac and Cheese

25 min
$8
450 kcal
Difficulty: 10%
Servings: 4

Allergens:

DairyGluten

Dietary Tags:

Vegetarian

Cuisine:

American

Course:

Main DishComfort Food

Tags:

Comfort FoodQuick MealCheesy

Description

Creamy, cheesy, and comforting, this one-pot mac and cheese is a quick and easy meal that everyone loves!

Ingredients

  • elbow macaroni: 2 cups
  • cheddar cheese: 2 cups, shredded
  • milk: 2 cups
  • butter: 2 tablespoons
  • salt: 1 teaspoon
  • black pepper: 1/2 teaspoon
  • garlic powder: 1/2 teaspoon

Date Created:

11/21/2024
